alert.note: Alert for Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 6:35PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following area, Near Jordan Creek. * WHEN...Until 630 PM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 632 PM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in Areas around the Jordan Creek Mall. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near Jordan Creek. Between 1.25 and 2 inches of rain have fallen with additional rain expected overnight. - Areas around the Jordan Creek Mall is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - For Jordan Creek near Juneau: At 6:00pm the stage was 9.58 feet. Flood Stage is 9.7 feet. Forecast: A crest around 10.0 feet is expected late Tuesday evening.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.

area.areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island
